title: Sri Lanka President meets top IMF Asia-Pacific staff
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has met top International Monetary Fund Asia Pacific staff as the cabinet of ministers gave the go ahead for Finance Minister Basil Rajapaksa to start negotiations with the International Monetary Fund.
IMF Asia Pacific Director Changyong Rhee, Deputy Director Anne-Marie Gulde-Wolf and Sri Lanka resident representative Tubagus Feridhanusetyawan were in the delegation, the President’s office said.

Central Bank Governor Ajith Nivard Cabraal, Secretary to the President Gamini Senarath, Principal Advisor to the President Lalith Weeratunga and Additional Secretary Chandima Wickramasinghe were also in the meeting.
Cabinet spokesman Ramesh Pathirana said the cabinet of ministers gave the go ahead to Finance Minister Basil Rajapaksa to negotiate with the IMF.
Sri Lanka has to raised interest rates to stabilize currency and also raise taxes to reduce domestic borrowings.
The IMF has also said Sri Lanka’s debt is unsustainable and has to be re-structured. Debt re-structuring also helps reduce the corrective interest rate. (Colombo/Mar16/2022)
